title: Hannah's Prayer and Samuel's Birth
shortSummary: This chapter introduces Elkanah’s family, focusing on Hannah’s deep anguish over her barrenness and her fervent prayer to God for a son. God answers her prayer by granting her Samuel, whom she dedicates to the Lord’s service, marking the beginning of a pivotal narrative in Israel’s history.
timeline: c. 1100 BC - Period of the Judges, before the establishment of the monarchy in Israel

keyCharacters.name: Hannah
keyCharacters.description: Elkanah’s wife who is initially barren; she prays earnestly to God for a son and dedicates him to the Lord’s service.

keyCharacters.name: Elkanah
keyCharacters.description: A man from Ramathaimzophim with two wives, who loves Hannah deeply and supports her in her distress.

keyCharacters.name: Peninnah
keyCharacters.description: Elkanah’s other wife who has children and provokes Hannah because of her barrenness.

keyCharacters.name: Eli
keyCharacters.description: The high priest at Shiloh who initially misunderstands Hannah’s silent prayer but then blesses her petition to God.

definitions.definition: A designation indicating a person from Ephrath or Bethlehem, often used to identify family lineage or tribal affiliation.
A solemn promise made to God, often involving a commitment or dedication in response to answered prayer.
A tool used for shaving; in this context, the vow that no razor would touch Samuel’s head signifies a Nazirite dedication to God.
A term meaning 'worthless' or 'wicked,' used here to deny that Hannah’s behavior was sinful or disgraceful.

outline.heading: Introduction to Elkanah’s Family and Hannah’s Barrenness
outline.description: The chapter opens by introducing Elkanah, his two wives, and the tension caused by Hannah’s inability to have children, highlighting the cultural and personal pain of barrenness.

outline.heading: Hannah’s Prayer and Vow to the Lord
outline.description: Hannah prays silently but passionately at the temple, making a vow to dedicate her son to God if her prayer is answered; Eli initially mistakes her for being drunk but then blesses her.

outline.heading: God Answers Hannah’s Prayer
outline.description: Hannah conceives and gives birth to Samuel, acknowledging that he is a gift from the Lord in direct response to her prayer.

outline.heading: Hannah’s Faithful Dedication of Samuel
outline.description: After weaning Samuel, Hannah brings him to the house of the Lord at Shiloh and dedicates him to lifelong service, fulfilling her vow and demonstrating obedience and faith.

application: Trust God in seasons of waiting and distress, bringing your deepest burdens to Him in prayer.
Make and keep vows to God as acts of faith and gratitude when He answers your prayers.
Encourage and support loved ones who are struggling with personal trials, showing love and understanding.
Dedicate your children and all blessings to the Lord’s service, acknowledging His sovereignty over your life.

keyVerses.text: And she vowed a vow, and said, O LORD of hosts, if thou wilt indeed look on the affliction of thine handmaid, and remember me, and not forget thine handmaid, but wilt give unto thine handmaid a man child, then I will give him unto the LORD all the days of his life, and there shall no razor come upon his head.
keyVerses.significance: This verse reveals Hannah’s heartfelt petition and the Nazirite vow that foreshadows Samuel’s special role in God’s plan.

keyVerses.text: Wherefore it came to pass, when the time was come about after Hannah had conceived, that she bare a son, and called his name Samuel, saying, Because I have asked him of the LORD.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights God’s faithfulness in answering prayer and the significance of Samuel’s birth as a divine gift.

keyVerses.text: For this child I prayed; and the LORD hath given me my petition which I asked of him:
keyVerses.significance: Hannah’s testimony of answered prayer encourages believers to trust God’s timing and faithfulness.

keyVerses.text: Therefore also I have lent him to the LORD; as long as he liveth he shall be lent to the LORD. And he worshipped the LORD there.
keyVerses.significance: This verse emphasizes the importance of dedicating what God has given us back to Him in faithful service.
